facts.1: Nelson Mandela International Day was officially declared by the United Nations in November 2009, with the first UN Mandela Day held on July 18, 2010.
facts.2: The day is a global call to action to make an imprint and change the world, urging people to dedicate 67 minutes to helping others.
facts.3: Mandela's message was to spread justice and freedom for all, reflected in this day.

facts.1: World Listening Day honors R. Murray Schafer's birthday and his introduction of the 'soundscape' concept.
facts.2: The World Listening Project promotes the practice of attentive listening and understanding acoustic ecology.
facts.3: Each year, the event has a theme that encourages reflection on aspects of the listening experience.

facts.1: International Día del Amigo is inspired by the Apollo 11 moon landing and is celebrated on July 18.
facts.2: The day is popular on social networks, where messages of friendship are exchanged.
facts.3: Celebrated with social gatherings, the day emphasizes companionship's role in life.
